bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to [Dorsey M. McPherson], September 29, 1879

div1.p: Reed writes that he has heard rumors that [McPherson] wishes to have his commission annulled. Reed disapproves of this.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to [Dorsey M. McPherson], September 29, 1879
div1.p:
I hear rumored that you are
going to ask to have contract an-
nulled Octr 1st- Just one word- Don't
you do anything of the kind, my dear
fellow- Don't even think of it- If
you should write such a letter, send
it to me & I will pigeon-hole it
at once- I write in great haste,
